12

Angola, Indiana.

Sept. 23, 1912. 
My dear Mr. 8 tearns :

d very much regret to be 
compelled to offer an apology for not 
writing to you for so long a time. I enten 
to write you several times but amin 
to my laggness and good time we had 
in our engineering Camp I was reglectful 
Really d am shumed to tell you of another 
delay which was that in returning to our 
Camp I injured my right leg by a fall 
from a bridge which disabled me from 
July 30. to september 15. This kind of painful 
suffering was the first I ever had in my 
life. I have been lying in a fast Wayne 
Hospital for almost six weeks and under 
the care of a Woctor. Am now very glad 
that I feel well and stronger than before.

I learned that you are planning 
to spend the most of next year abroad 
No doubt the students and faculty will 
greatly miss you next year. However,

trust that you and your family 
will have a most enjoyable

metadata.abstract: Letter apologizing for not writing because of spending time in Engineering Camp, followed by a fall that caused a leg injury and hospitalization in Fort Wayne from July 30th to September 15th. He wishes Stearns an enjoyable year abroad. Luk cannot remit money owed prior to Stearns' trip and asks for advice.
